meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of the idea that universal principles apply to all people or situations.
meanings.sent1: Her strong universalisms guided her actions towards fairness for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The concept of universalisms in ethics ensures equal treatment for all individuals.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they joked that universalisms meant everyone should have the same favorite color.
meanings.sent4: In a world of diverse opinions, universalisms can be a beacon of unity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used universalisms to explain why honesty is important in all cultures.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being universal in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The universalisms of mathematics make it a language understood worldwide.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of art lies in its universalisms that transcend cultural boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously exaggerated the universalisms of fashion trends.
meanings.sent4: Nature's universalisms remind us of the interconnectedness of all living things.
meanings.sent5: The film captured the universalisms of love that resonate with audiences of all ages.
